entries.content: Utilize a prospect's known negative perception of your industry/role to your advantage in the opening.
If I told you that this call was about [negative industry/role], would a little piece of you die?
entries.notes: Used to elicit an honest reaction or vent from the prospect based on common negative experiences.

entries.content: When a prospect reacts negatively or vents about a common pain point, listen actively and acknowledge their frustration.
Well look, before you hang up, can I ask a question? Why does everybody say that?
entries.notes: Used to encourage the prospect to vent and clarify the specific reasons for their negative perception. Related to AAA/Clarify.

entries.content: Allow the prospect to vent fully about their frustrations. Listening is crucial to understanding and isolating the objection.
After the prospect vents, differentiate your approach to attempt to overcome the negative perception or objection.
If I was to guarantee that the next 30 seconds would be completely different from every other call you got, would you hear me out?
entries.notes: Used after a prospect vents to differentiate and gain permission to continue. Related to Overcome.
